definition: to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: Enclosed is my resume, and hoping for your immediate reply.
sentences.chinese: 简历随信附上，希望早获回音。

sentences.english: Would you please take a few minutes to look over the resume which I have enclosed?
sentences.chinese: 麻烦您花几分钟时间看一下我随信附上的简历。

sentences.english: Enclosing is a postage paid envelope for your convenience.
sentences.chinese: 为了您的方便起见，随信附上已付邮资的信封。

sentences.english: We have pleasure in enclosing herewith a Bill of Lading covering 50 bales of cotton.
sentences.chinese: 兹随信附去50包棉花的提单一张。

sentences.english: Please find enclosed 200 instruction manuals as you requested.
sentences.chinese: 请注意，随信所附是你方所需的200本说明书。

sentences.english: I enclose two tickets along with this letter.
Enclosed please find a brief resume.
sentences.chinese: 随信附寄个人简历一份。

sentences.english: Encloses is a copy of the credit advice .
sentences.chinese: 随信所寄的是一封贷记通知。

sentences.english: I am enclosing the envelope, which shows the postmarks of the post office in Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 随信附上那只信封，上面印有上海邮局的邮戳。

sentences.english: I enclose herewith a cheque for 10 pounds .
sentences.chinese: 随信附上十镑支票一张。

definition: to bring sth to sb (news etc)
to reply/to write back/letter written in reply/CL:封[feng1]
to pass on to sb/to carry and give to sb else
to forward (a message, letter, article etc)
